Hi all,

Does anyone have this "updated" KineticsFrame.py file that Dr. Go=
odwin
sent sometime ago? The attachment is not store anymore, and I am havi=
ng
the same problem with visualizing the reaction  paths in MixMaster. I
ge=
t the error message "language gif not recognized". I looked for the
file in=
 the CVS repositories, but could not find it. Thanks for your
attention. Be=
st regards, Peter

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@=
...> wrote:
>
> Sure enough, in a recent version of a graphics library that=
 graphviz
> uses to generate bitmap images, support for the GIF format was
=
removed.
> It has now been restored, but it seems that the version of graph=
viz
> available for download was built with the library version without GIF=

> support. But in any case, dot supports PNG and SVG formats, which can
> =
be viewed in an external browser. In the attached file, I have changed
> th=
e default to display SVG in a web browser. Put it in folder
> 'site_package=
s/MixMaster' in the Python library folder to update
> MixMaster.
>
>
>
> On=
 Feb 16, 2005, at 3:35 PM, David Goodwin wrote:
>
> >
> > Carl -
> >
> > Th=
is is due to your version of 'dot' (part of graphviz) not
supporting
> > 'g=
if' files. As it turns out, I just upgraded to the latest version
of
> > gr=
aphviz on the Mac, and I am getting this error too. I hope they
> > haven't=
 dropped support for gif output... Let me look into it a
little
> > more.
>=
 >
> > Dave
> >
> >
> > On Feb 16, 2005, at 12:17 PM, carlmas20032003 wrote=
:
> >
> >>
> >>

is

reinstalling everything as all the other functions seem to work (I
am

using the Matlab interface). Thoughts are welcome,
